abstract: The company’s chief financial officer told Wall Street analysts that it was stopping production on an animation film, and that summer ad revenue at ABC was softer than expected.
snippet: The company’s chief financial officer told Wall Street analysts that it was stopping production on an animation film, and that summer ad revenue at ABC was softer than expected.
lead_paragraph: James A. Rasulo, Disney’s chief financial officer, unexpectedly revealed two important tidbits at a gathering of Wall Street analysts on Thursday: The company will take a $50 million write-down at its movie studio, and summer advertising revenue at ABC was softer than expected.

headline.main: Disney Unexpectedly Reveals Movie Write-Down and Sluggish Ad Revenue
